description: Those looking to complete the initial Mac Integration Basics exam to obtain the Apple Certified Associates (ACA) Certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the exam required to pass in order to receive the certification. One will learn in this course how to use Mac OS in a corporate/ enterprise environment, integrate it with other systems, and learn how to perform actions such as sharing files, printers, and other things that run between multiple systems running Mac OS.
name: Mac Integration Basics 10.9
subtitle: Mavericks 10.9

episodes.description: The Apple Certified Associate (ACA) certification is an entry level certification that shows one has a basic understanding of how to use Mac OS in a corporate or enterprise environment and can integrate it with other systems. The ACA certification can be achieved in two versions through either Mac Integration Basics or Mac Management Basics and is an excellent starting point for people working with Macintosh systems in a networked environment. Viewers will hear an overview about the knowledge one needs to attain the ACA certification, about the Mac Integration Basics Exam and the exam objectives of topics one should know for the exam.
episodes.title: Overview of Mac Integration Basics
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:08,102
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:08,102 --> 00:00:12,159
So I want to take a moment to talk about
the Apple Certified Associates and

3
00:00:12,159 --> 00:00:14,886
particularly the Mac
Integration Basics Exam,

4
00:00:14,886 --> 00:00:19,825
that we can take to obtain the Apple
Certified Associate Certification.

5
00:00:19,825 --> 00:00:22,775
First off, the ACA,
the Apple Certified Associate,

6
00:00:22,775 --> 00:00:24,990
we'll see how many times
I can say it in a minute.

7
00:00:24,990 --> 00:00:29,392
[LAUGH] So the ACA it's an entry
level certification with Apple

8
00:00:29,392 --> 00:00:34,112
that shows that you have or
the tester has a basic understanding of

9
00:00:34,112 --> 00:00:38,792
how to use Mac OS in a corporate or
enterprise environment.

10
00:00:38,792 --> 00:00:42,612
There's two versions of this,
the Mac Management Basics,

11
00:00:42,612 --> 00:00:46,640
which we cover in another show, and
this one the Mac Integration Basics.

12
00:00:46,640 --> 00:00:51,630
With Mac Integration we're looking
at topics that surround using a Mac,

13
00:00:51,630 --> 00:00:55,075
a machine specifically
running OS X Mavericks or

14
00:00:55,075 --> 00:00:58,130
OS 10 Mavericks in
a corporate environment.

15
00:00:58,130 --> 00:01:01,310
So an environment where you
have more than one Mac.

16
00:01:01,310 --> 00:01:04,240
Anybody can fire up a Mac laptop or
desktop and get to work.

17
00:01:04,240 --> 00:01:06,960
Right?
Using it by itself is really pretty easy.

18
00:01:06,960 --> 00:01:10,990
But when we start integrating, using the
Mac with other systems, there's a couple

19
00:01:10,990 --> 00:01:15,060
of things that we need to be aware of, and
that's what this certification covers.

20
00:01:15,060 --> 00:01:18,530
We take a look at getting Macs to
participate together on a network, so

21
00:01:18,530 --> 00:01:20,320
just sharing files, printers,

22
00:01:20,320 --> 00:01:24,100
other things like that between
multiple systems running Mac OS.

23
00:01:24,100 --> 00:01:28,340
We also take a look at integrating
our systems with Windows machines,

24
00:01:28,340 --> 00:01:29,600
because in a lot of corporate and

25
00:01:29,600 --> 00:01:33,780
business environments, you're going to
have Microsoft Windows pretty heavily.

26
00:01:33,780 --> 00:01:36,930
I think it's something like 80% of
the business market share right now.

27
00:01:36,930 --> 00:01:41,810
So while you might be firmly entrenched
in the Mac world, many people aren't.

28
00:01:41,810 --> 00:01:45,160
And so we need to get our
systems playing nicely together.

29
00:01:45,160 --> 00:01:47,990
So we take a look at doing file
sharing and sharing printers,

30
00:01:47,990 --> 00:01:51,090
stuff like that, between a Mac and
a Windows machine.

31
00:01:51,090 --> 00:01:54,470
And we'll look at how we can migrate,
so maybe you're making the switch or

32
00:01:54,470 --> 00:01:57,430
you're getting rid of those Windows
machines, and you're moving over to Mac.

33
00:01:57,430 --> 00:02:00,870
So we'll take a look at how to bring
our user data over, our settings,

34
00:02:00,870 --> 00:02:04,450
our files, all that good stuff, and
make that transition a little bit easier.

35
00:02:04,450 --> 00:02:08,460
Because you know how it is with end users,
they're always resistant to change.

36
00:02:08,460 --> 00:02:11,630
We wanna make things as painless as
possible to get them to move over.

37
00:02:11,630 --> 00:02:14,730
So those are some of the topics
that we take a look at,

38
00:02:14,730 --> 00:02:17,310
as we go through this certification.

39
00:02:17,310 --> 00:02:20,890
Now, let me talk just a little bit
about attaining this certification.

40
00:02:20,890 --> 00:02:23,680
The certification itself
is pretty straight forward.

41
00:02:23,680 --> 00:02:28,180
This is one of the ones I really like,
because it is so straight forward.

42
00:02:28,180 --> 00:02:32,430
The exam is a 50 question,
I'm sorry a 45 question

43
00:02:32,430 --> 00:02:37,840
exam that is based entirely
on the content from one book.

44
00:02:37,840 --> 00:02:40,780
One book that is made available for
free online.

45
00:02:40,780 --> 00:02:42,120
That's part of what makes this so awesome.

46
00:02:42,120 --> 00:02:44,190
This is an extremely low
cost certification to get.

47
00:02:44,190 --> 00:02:46,030
And for an entry level certification,

48
00:02:46,030 --> 00:02:47,660
there's absolutely no
reason you shouldn't do it.

49
00:02:47,660 --> 00:02:49,640
It looks great on the resume.

50
00:02:49,640 --> 00:02:51,110
So where do we get that book?

51
00:02:51,110 --> 00:02:53,610
Well, what we do is we
go to Apple's website.

52
00:02:53,610 --> 00:02:56,430
And Apple has a website dedicated
to their certifications,

53
00:02:56,430 --> 00:03:00,074
it's training.apple.com/certification.

54
00:03:00,074 --> 00:03:01,910
And if you jump over to that website,

55
00:03:01,910 --> 00:03:04,760
you'll see on there where they've got
their creative certifications for

56
00:03:04,760 --> 00:03:09,400
the design professionals, and then the IT
professionals, that's what we're doing.

57
00:03:09,400 --> 00:03:11,570
This is a Maverick certification, so

58
00:03:11,570 --> 00:03:16,030
every time a new version of Mac OS comes
out they update the certifications.

59
00:03:16,030 --> 00:03:17,220
It's usually not right away.

60
00:03:17,220 --> 00:03:20,070
So for example at this time,

61
00:03:20,070 --> 00:03:23,080
I know you guys are probably watching
this video later on in the future.

62
00:03:23,080 --> 00:03:27,804
But at this time they've announced
Mac OS Yosemite the next version which is

63
00:03:27,804 --> 00:03:28,899
going to be 10.10.

64
00:03:28,899 --> 00:03:32,330
But the 10.10 certifications
won't come out until well

65
00:03:32,330 --> 00:03:34,710
after the OS is actually in our hands.

66
00:03:34,710 --> 00:03:36,990
So right now Mavericks
is the most recent on,

67
00:03:36,990 --> 00:03:40,410
and if you go into that
Mavericks certifications link.

68
00:03:40,410 --> 00:03:44,120
You'll see where they detail the four
certification exams that they

69
00:03:44,120 --> 00:03:45,520
have right now.

70
00:03:45,520 --> 00:03:49,130
Actually, it's five,
it's a four certifications, five tests.

71
00:03:49,130 --> 00:03:53,880
The Apple certified associate, you'll see
there's two different ones listed here.

72
00:03:53,880 --> 00:03:56,020
One for Mac Management Basics, and one for

73
00:03:56,020 --> 00:03:59,360
Mac Integration Basics,
they're both very similar.

74
00:03:59,360 --> 00:04:02,100
And see how it says,
that they're available online.

75
00:04:02,100 --> 00:04:06,240
If you want to pursue your Apple Certified
Associate, you just come in here.

76
00:04:06,240 --> 00:04:07,060
And if you click on it,

77
00:04:07,060 --> 00:04:09,880
you'll see where they tell you what
you need to do to get certified.

78
00:04:09,880 --> 00:04:12,810
You need to take that exam,
and here's the PDF.

79
00:04:12,810 --> 00:04:17,170
You can download this manual right here.

80
00:04:17,170 --> 00:04:18,720
This is the book.

81
00:04:18,720 --> 00:04:21,040
It's not very, very giant at all.

82
00:04:21,040 --> 00:04:24,630
You can sit down and read this over
the course of one or maybe two days and

83
00:04:24,630 --> 00:04:25,830
get the material.

84
00:04:25,830 --> 00:04:28,570
All the test questions come
right from this book, so

85
00:04:28,570 --> 00:04:30,040
it's a great resource to have.

86
00:04:30,040 --> 00:04:34,060
We really don't need too much
else to get ready for the exam.

87
00:04:34,060 --> 00:04:36,580
When you're ready to actually take
the exam, you'll see back here,

88
00:04:36,580 --> 00:04:38,090
where it says available online.

89
00:04:38,090 --> 00:04:40,350
I'm just gonna hit that
available online link.

90
00:04:40,350 --> 00:04:43,700
And it takes you to a page and
describes the exam itself.

91
00:04:43,700 --> 00:04:48,530
So it tells you it is $65, and
that you can take it through Pearson VUE.

92
00:04:48,530 --> 00:04:53,580
Pearson VUE is a company that does
certification exams all across the world.

93
00:04:53,580 --> 00:04:57,080
This is one of the special exams
though that you can take online.

94
00:04:57,080 --> 00:04:59,830
You don't actually have to go
to a Pearson VUE Center or

95
00:04:59,830 --> 00:05:01,860
to an Apple Authorized Training Center.

96
00:05:01,860 --> 00:05:04,650
You can, if you want,
you can go to an AATC.

97
00:05:04,650 --> 00:05:09,150
But if you're like me, the nearest
AATC to me is two hours drive away.

98
00:05:09,150 --> 00:05:11,480
I have to drive two hours
to go take this exam.

99
00:05:11,480 --> 00:05:13,400
But you can take this one online.

100
00:05:13,400 --> 00:05:16,170
If you wanna do it online,
notice this code.

101
00:05:16,170 --> 00:05:19,990
Enter MavOSX109, right there.

102
00:05:19,990 --> 00:05:23,830
So that code is what will allow you
to take it online instead of going

103
00:05:23,830 --> 00:05:24,410
to a center.

104
00:05:24,410 --> 00:05:28,050
And it's right here on the webpage,
so you just copy that code.

105
00:05:28,050 --> 00:05:32,340
So you've got it, if you can master
the copy the command here which,

106
00:05:32,340 --> 00:05:36,570
I'm screwing up, and then we can jump
on over to Pearson's website, and

107
00:05:36,570 --> 00:05:38,290
sign up to take the exam.

108
00:05:38,290 --> 00:05:41,100
So when you go here,
you'll be able to purchase the exam.

109
00:05:41,100 --> 00:05:46,300
You log in as your account, and you put
in your code, and once you've done that

110
00:05:46,300 --> 00:05:52,250
you buy the exam for $65, and then
you'll have 48 hours to take the exam.

111
00:05:52,250 --> 00:05:55,850
At some point in the next 48 hours
you need to log in to the website and

112
00:05:55,850 --> 00:05:56,580
take the exam.

113
00:05:56,580 --> 00:06:00,200
Right there, from the comfort of your
own home move through it and go.

114
00:06:00,200 --> 00:06:02,510
It's a really honest exam.

115
00:06:02,510 --> 00:06:07,110
Some exams get really trick questions, and
questions outside of the course material.

116
00:06:07,110 --> 00:06:08,900
This one is really straight forward.

117
00:06:08,900 --> 00:06:10,680
The questions do come
right out of this book.

118
00:06:10,680 --> 00:06:13,780
So if you've read the book, if you've
done the labs, you've done the exercises,

119
00:06:13,780 --> 00:06:17,060
you understand the concept,
you won't have a problem passing the exam.

120
00:06:18,180 --> 00:06:22,400
Now, to show you that code, I'm just
gonna go to Pearson's main page here.

121
00:06:22,400 --> 00:06:26,685
And when we go to their page, and
we want to get information about a test,

122
00:06:26,685 --> 00:06:31,063
we can go to this Test Taker's Services,
and we can go in here and pick IT.

123
00:06:31,063 --> 00:06:35,093
And you will see Apple has two
divisions in here, Apple IT and

124
00:06:35,093 --> 00:06:37,530
pro apps as well as AppleCare.

125
00:06:37,530 --> 00:06:40,490
AppleCare that is for
the people seeking to do warranty work for

126
00:06:40,490 --> 00:06:42,510
Apple, warranty hardware repair.

127
00:06:42,510 --> 00:06:44,560
That's not what we're doing,
so we'll go to Apple IT,

128
00:06:44,560 --> 00:06:48,200
and when you go in here you'll
see information about the exams.

129
00:06:48,200 --> 00:06:52,480
And you can go in and
actually sign up, to take an exam.

130
00:06:52,480 --> 00:06:53,700
And if you go through,

131
00:06:53,700 --> 00:06:57,500
when you go to sign up, you'll see a blank
to punch in the code for that exam.

132
00:06:57,500 --> 00:07:01,440
So let's see, I don't necessarily
want to sign in with my account,

133
00:07:01,440 --> 00:07:03,520
let me see if it will,
let me do it from here.

134
00:07:03,520 --> 00:07:05,570
It's gonna make me sign in.

135
00:07:05,570 --> 00:07:07,670
Well anyhow, once you sign in,

136
00:07:07,670 --> 00:07:10,580
you go to purchase exam,
just remember to put in that code.

137
00:07:10,580 --> 00:07:14,400
You'll see the exam listed even if,
you don't put in the code.

138
00:07:14,400 --> 00:07:18,495
The exam that's listed by default,
that's the one that requires you to go to

139
00:07:18,495 --> 00:07:21,082
an Apple Authorized Training Center,
an AATC.

140
00:07:21,082 --> 00:07:24,330
You'll have to physically go to
the center to take the exam.

141
00:07:24,330 --> 00:07:28,060
But when you put in
the code the exam changes.

142
00:07:28,060 --> 00:07:31,560
The exam changes and it now is the one
that'll be able to be taken online.

143
00:07:31,560 --> 00:07:34,370
So that it is really
important that you do that,

144
00:07:34,370 --> 00:07:37,740
to make sure that you go in and
get that chance.

145
00:07:37,740 --> 00:07:42,760
And I wanted to show you that because
the exam number, I just wanted to

146
00:07:42,760 --> 00:07:46,190
get information of about the exam without
logging in, apparently its gonna make me.

147
00:07:46,190 --> 00:07:49,560
But the exam number is
listed there on the site,

148
00:07:49,560 --> 00:07:53,800
I can't remember it off hand its
like 4L0-109 or something like that.

149
00:07:53,800 --> 00:07:57,535
And when you put in the code
the exam number changes and

150
00:07:57,535 --> 00:08:00,545
it adds NP to the end of the number.

151
00:08:00,545 --> 00:08:04,215
And that means non proctored in other
words your not going to the center.

152
00:08:04,215 --> 00:08:06,545
So make sure you do that, once you do it,

153
00:08:06,545 --> 00:08:10,507
you now have access to the online exam,
they give you two hours.

154
00:08:10,507 --> 00:08:14,967
So 45 questions over two hours,
which is plenty of time.

155
00:08:14,967 --> 00:08:18,087
I think most people say
they finish under one hour.

156
00:08:18,087 --> 00:08:22,137
So it's not a high pressure exam, you
can take your time and move through it.

157
00:08:22,137 --> 00:08:24,307
So that's definitely a good thing.

158
00:08:24,307 --> 00:08:27,647
Once you're through it, you get your
results right at the end of the exam.

159
00:08:27,647 --> 00:08:29,520
So you'll know if you passed or failed.

160
00:08:29,520 --> 00:08:33,310
You get a pass if you get
80% of the questions right.

161
00:08:33,310 --> 00:08:34,020
So that's not bad.

162
00:08:34,020 --> 00:08:37,510
Four out of five questions you
gotta get right out of your 45.

163
00:08:37,510 --> 00:08:41,910
Now, there are five questions
on the exam that are not scored.

164
00:08:41,910 --> 00:08:45,160
That means that Apple is basically
putting in a couple of questions that

165
00:08:45,160 --> 00:08:47,040
they're not sure are ready for prime time.

166
00:08:47,040 --> 00:08:49,640
They're kind of testing them out to see,
how it goes?

167
00:08:49,640 --> 00:08:52,900
So those questions, they look at
your results to determine whether or

168
00:08:52,900 --> 00:08:55,990
not they should incorporate those
as real questions later on, but for

169
00:08:55,990 --> 00:08:57,300
your exam the won't be scored.

170
00:08:57,300 --> 00:09:00,600
Now, I tell you that,
because you'll see a message about it,

171
00:09:00,600 --> 00:09:02,200
when you go to take the exam.

172
00:09:02,200 --> 00:09:05,580
But don't worry about it,
because you don't know

173
00:09:05,580 --> 00:09:08,670
which five questions are not scored,
they don't tell you.

174
00:09:08,670 --> 00:09:11,110
So just treat it like a 45 question exam.

175
00:09:11,110 --> 00:09:13,790
Don't try and figure out which ones
are not scored, cuz you can't.

176
00:09:13,790 --> 00:09:18,484
So just go through,
take your 45 questions and pass the exam.

177
00:09:18,484 --> 00:09:20,300
An 80% will get you a pass.

178
00:09:20,300 --> 00:09:24,130
Most of the questions are multiple choice,
so your just picking an answer.

179
00:09:24,130 --> 00:09:28,390
Some are choose all that apply, so you'll
have to check off various options there's

180
00:09:28,390 --> 00:09:31,770
more than one answer and
then others are picture questions.

181
00:09:31,770 --> 00:09:33,640
I love the picture questions
it'll show you a picture,

182
00:09:33,640 --> 00:09:37,790
and it'll say things like, where would
you click to perform this activity?

183
00:09:37,790 --> 00:09:40,250
And so you just select, where on
the screen you would click to go and

184
00:09:40,250 --> 00:09:41,710
perform that activity.

185
00:09:41,710 --> 00:09:43,140
Like I said, really straight forward.

186
00:09:43,140 --> 00:09:44,140
I do like these exams.

187
00:09:45,610 --> 00:09:49,240
All right, so that's a little bit about
the Apple Certified Associate Exam.

188
00:09:49,240 --> 00:09:51,350
And how we take it and
how we get the certification?

189
00:09:51,350 --> 00:09:54,720
Now, who would be a good candidate
to take this certification?

190
00:09:54,720 --> 00:09:56,400
Well, just about anybody.

191
00:09:56,400 --> 00:10:00,750
If you're working in an IT environment and
you support Macintosh PCs and

192
00:10:00,750 --> 00:10:04,030
Laptops, then this is a great
certification for you.

193
00:10:04,030 --> 00:10:09,370
If you're a Windows admin, and you're
looking to start supporting Apple stuff,

194
00:10:09,370 --> 00:10:11,490
this is a great certification for you.

195
00:10:11,490 --> 00:10:15,710
If you just a home user, and you want to
learn a little bit more about the advanced

196
00:10:15,710 --> 00:10:19,530
functionality of having more then one Mac,
this is a great certification for you.

197
00:10:19,530 --> 00:10:22,300
But if your just a home user with one
machine or you're a business user with

198
00:10:22,300 --> 00:10:26,150
just one machine, it's not necessarily
the greatest certification for

199
00:10:26,150 --> 00:10:28,700
you, cuz it is all about
integrating with other systems.

200
00:10:28,700 --> 00:10:32,680
So that is really the key component,
anybody who is supporting more than one

201
00:10:32,680 --> 00:10:37,559
PC, were one of the PCs is running Mac OS
then you're gonna benefit from this exam.

202
00:10:37,559 --> 00:10:41,580
So definitely a great one,
I hope to see you guys in this show.

203
00:10:41,580 --> 00:10:44,940
If you're gonna take the exam,
best of luck to you.

204
00:10:44,940 --> 00:10:48,730
Always keep in mind that with us, you
get our shows where we cover the exams.

205
00:10:48,730 --> 00:10:51,410
So we'll go over all these topics
in each of our episodes, but

206
00:10:51,410 --> 00:10:52,880
you also have the Q and A forum.

207
00:10:52,880 --> 00:10:56,040
So if you have any questions on
the material as you go through it,

208
00:10:56,040 --> 00:10:57,550
make sure that you reach out to us and
ask.

209
00:10:57,550 --> 00:10:59,790
We definitely want to help and
make sure you're ready for

210
00:10:59,790 --> 00:11:01,480
that exam when you go and take it.

211
00:11:01,480 --> 00:11:02,140
All right.

212
00:11:02,140 --> 00:11:04,090
So I hope to see you then.

213
00:11:04,090 --> 00:11:08,779
Stay tuned, because we've got more
Mac Integration episodes coming up soon.

214
00:11:08,779 --> 00:11:14,442
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: A lot of the Mac operating system is directed more towards home users, but in corporate, business, or enterprise environments the need for network functions usually arise. Viewers will hear about Open Directory, Active Directory, and the process of binding a client to a directory for the purpose of centralized user management.
episodes.title: Network Accounts

episodes.description: Being able to share information between systems is an important step in setting up a Mac to work in a network environment. Viewers will hear about the different methods for file sharing that are supported and see demonstrations for Mac-to-Mac and Mac-to-Windows file sharing.
episodes.title: File Sharing

episodes.description: In taking a look at Mac integration, connecting to various network services can make some things more convenient for the user. Viewers will hear about the process of integrating email, calendars, and contacts in with the Mac system.
episodes.title: Email, Calendars, and Contacts

episodes.description: Mac OS has a ton of security features built into it, but not all are initially enabled, so one should utilize the features according to their needs. Viewers will hear about the different modes in Password Assistant and other security features including setting firmware passwords, enabling FileVault and the firewall, and others.
episodes.title: Security

episodes.description: Printers are still a very common and useful device, especially in business type settings that rely on printed documentation. Viewers will hear about the process of adding printers to a system and the different types of printers Mac OS supports.
episodes.title: Printing

episodes.description: iMessage is a software package that's included with Mac OS used for instant messaging. Viewers will see demonstrations on how to configure iMessage and to set it up to a Jabber/ XMPP server, and also hear how it works and what all it does.
episodes.title: Instant Message

episodes.description: Backing up and managing data is important especially when transferring data to new systems and when wanting to avoid data loss in the event of a hard drive failure or a similar instance. Viewers will hear about moving system information over from Windows to Mac through the Migration Assistant tool, other ways Apple recommends moving data between systems, and the backup process through Time Machine.
episodes.title: Data Management and Backup

episodes.description: Cross-platform compatibility refers to the ability of certain software or applications to operate across multiple platforms as opposed to only one. Viewers will hear about how to virtualize a Windows environment on a Mac, how Boot Camp works to create a dual bootable system, and the steps in getting Boot Camp set up.
episodes.title: Cross-Platform Compatibility
